captions.text: [CAR ENGINE ROARING]
[MUSIC PLAYING]

The new Fiesta ST has 182
horsepower, and Ford claims

that it will accelerate from
rest to 62 miles an hour in
6.9 seconds.

We're at Bruntingthorpe to test
that claim and to also

investigate if there's a way
of making the Fiesta ST

accelerate faster without
touching the engine at all.

So how fast will a standard
Fiesta ST accelerate, anyway?
We have one here.

I've got this slightly uphill
section of Bruntingthorpe, and

I have a 182-horsepower
hot hatchback.

Let's roll her up to the line,
turn on my traction

controller, which will take
a couple of seconds.
Good.
3 and 1/2 thousand RPM?
I reckon.

About three and a half
thousand, maybe more.
Maybe four.
[CAR ENGINE REVVING]
It goes pretty well to me.

It always feels a bit brutal
when you're getting your

numbers out of a hot
hatch, doesn't it?
A manual gearbox.
It's all done by about 6:02.

So there's not much point in
taking it out much further.
There we are, indicated 100.

We think of these things
as not being that
quick, don't we?

But when I was younger, if I'd
had a small car with this kind

of performance, I'd have
been over the moon.
So there's 120.
What are the numbers?
Well, we got 0 to 60 in 7.2.
And we got 0 to 100 in 18.3.

That seems pretty reasonable
to me.

But is there a way of making a
Fiesta ST go from 0 to 60 and

from 0 to 100 even quicker,
without even touching the car?

Remember, we came here with an
Audi S4 and did some magic.

Well, there's even more magic
going to happen now.

And here it is, the Mercedes
G63 AMG and the Brian James
A-max Trailer.

The G-Class is a relic,
cryogenically preserved and
rammed with steroids.

It has 544 horsepower, 561
foot-pounds of torque, and I

think there's an outside chance
it could come close to

matching the Fiesta's own
acceleration times
whilst towing it.

On its own, it'll do 60 in 5.8
seconds on the slightly uphill
bit of the runway.
It's a complete animal.

We really ought to have
a practice before
we do this for real.

So let's venture out onto the
runway and see what happens.
I have 544 horsepower.

Behind me is a car that weighs
1,300 kilograms and a trailer

that weighs 645 kilograms,
we think.
It's a lot of weight.

I'll put it in sport, AND we'll
see what sort of numbers
we get, shall we?
[CAR ENGINE  REVVING]
That is absurd.

Nothing towing that weight
should be allowed to
accelerate that quickly.

70 indicated, 80, 90, that's
an indicator at 105.

Now look, I'm going to back off
there, and I'm not going
to describe the numbers.
I'll tell you why.

Because sitting here right now,
I think I should figure
it from inside the Fiesta.
This is about the Fiesta.

So I think we'll get Neil to
drive the G-Wagen, and I'll

just sit in the Fiesta with the
VBOX, and I'll read the
numbers out from there.

But I might have a little peek
now and see what it did.
It could be good.
This is a bit unnerving then.
Neil is getting into the G63.

I'm sitting in the
Fiesta, behind.

I've never been involved in a
sort of figuring session where

I could look at my emails
as I was going on.

So this is really clever
because the VBOX is

bluetoothed, so I can see
the speed readout here.

I'm connected to the VBOX which
is actually on the front
of the G-Wagen.

So I suppose, we ought to
have a go, haven't we?

Here we go then, figuring a
car without being in it.
Oh, my god, that's alarming.
That'll do, Neil.
Slow down.
Thank you.
Bloody hell.
Right, OK.

We just did 0 to 60
in 9 seconds and 0
to 100 in 22 seconds.

So the Fiesta's honor
stays intact.

The Fiesta ST is quicker under
it's own power than it is
being towed by a G63.
But that thing is a monster!
We're 2 tons back here.

That weighs 2 and a 1.2 tons,
and this is 2 tons.

So at 4 and a 1/2 tons,
the G-Wagen--
the G63--

still has the performance of
a kind of reasonably fast,
executive saloon car.

And I'm now going to do a few
emails sitting back here.
JF Musial, where the [BEEP]
is my money this month?

Mike Spinelli, when will you
learn to speak properly?

Matt Farah, why are
you so big?

Mike Musto, all old
cars are lovely.
You're correct.

title: Ford Fiesta ST v. Mercedes G63 AMG, Sort Of. - /CHRIS HARRIS ON CARS
